TopicTitle: Kerbinovski Aerospace Bureau of Orbital Mechanics (KABoOM)*

Articles.Content:
Hello all.

Addictive little game.

Having a blast.

FAR, improved navball, Kerbin Engineer redux, Protractor, Final Frontier - all of these have enhanced my enjoyment of the simulation and my hat is off to the fine folks behind the mods.

I must also thank my friends at JSC and JPL who have been screwing off on company time and who talked me into this little time-sucking simulation. Bastards! First one is free. I should have known.

I don't like Jeb sneaking aboard every chance he gets. Nobody likes a glory-hound ... except the public, congressmen, cheerleaders, prom queens, the local American Legion, 5th graders, my wife, well... that about covers it.

I'm running my own little science-centric space agency, having a blast, and enjoying the simplified world of two-body physics from thirty-five years ago. There's a 41CV hanging around somewhere in the basement with all my earliest numeric iteration programs. It's jealous.

{In Julia Child voice} "First, we take the capsule firmly like so ... holding the separation collar gently in our right hand..."

* Application requirements? A degree or two in engineering physics or an equivalent set of dental x-rays.

Thanks all.

Bearpig. (barschwein to you)

Welcome barschwein. It's a great game and a friendly community. Check out the Science lab. http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/45-The-Science-Labs

I don't like Jeb sneaking aboard every chance he gets. Nobody likes a glory-hound ... except the public, congressmen, cheerleaders, prom queens, the local American Legion, 5th graders, my wife, well... that about covers it.

There's a mod for that. Can't find the link but someone'll be along directly. Is it called Jeb git offa my rocket? or something.

Edit- Ha. Got it. RealRoster.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/87473-24-2-RealRoster-Get-off-mah-rocket-Jeb!-RC1-7-21-11/page4

I've never used Protractor but I do love K(erbal) A(larm) C(lock).

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24786-0-24-2-Kerbal-Alarm-Clock-v2-7-8-2-(July-28)
